1:
Call Waveguide FDE Solver with -> obj.Solver("Waveguide", "FDE", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.
        Example: Parameters['Substrate Height'] = 600

    --- Waveguide Geometry ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Operating wavelength of the solver.

    --- Solver Mesh ---
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the y-direction.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the z-direction.

    --- Solver Window ---
    Parameters['Solver y span'] : float
        Window span in y-direction. Centered on the waveguide.
        Default: 5e-6
    Parameters['Solver z span'] : float
        Window span in z-direction. Centered on the waveguide.
        Default: 5e-6

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2:
Call MMI2x1 EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("MMI2x1", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the slab in micrometers.

    --- MMI Geometry ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI region.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI region.
    Parameters['angle'] : float
        Angle of the waveguide walls. Calculated as WG_angle = 90 - angle.
        For angle = 90 → perfect rectangle.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between the waveguides. If Taper=True, offset is applied to taper wide sides.
        Minimum distance = 1 µm due to manufacturing restrictions.
    Parameters['Offset Input'] : float
        Input waveguide/taper offset.
    Parameters['Offset Output'] : optional
        Allows moving the outputs in the opposite direction (used for machine limitations).

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        Add taper to the structure on input and output waveguides.
        True → taper applied
        False → no taper
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the y-direction.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the z-direction.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Wavelength of the simulation.
    Parameters['Mode'] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters['Port Span'] : list of float
        Span of the solver ports [x span, y span, z span].
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3:
Call MMI2x2 EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("MMI2x2", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the slab in micrometers.

    --- MMI Geometry ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI region.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI region.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.

    --- Waveguide Placement ---
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between the waveguides. If Taper=True, offset is applied to taper wide sides.
        Minimum distance = 1 µm due to manufacturing restrictions.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        Add taper to the structure on input and output waveguides.
        True → taper applied
        False → no taper
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper if Taper=True. Ignored if Taper=False.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the y-direction.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh cell size in the z-direction.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Wavelength of the simulation.
    Parameters['Mode'] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters['Port Span'] : list of float
        Span of the solver ports [x span, y span, z span].
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4:
Call InverseTaper EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("InverseTaper", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide. Also the height of the MMI section.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.

    --- Photonic Wirebonding (PWB) ---
    Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back'] : float
        Width of the back side of the PWB taper.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back'] : float
        Height of the back side of the PWB taper.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the PWB taper.

    --- Fiber Coupling ---
    Parameters["SMF Core Diameter"] : float
        Single Mode Fiber core diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Diameter"] : float
        Single Mode Fiber cladding diameter.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along y-axis.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along z-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters['Mode'] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters['Port Span'] : list of float
        Span of solver ports [x span, y span, z span]. Only y and z spans are used in this simulation.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5:
Call DirectionalCoupler EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("DirectionalCoupler", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.
    Parameters['Substrate Width'] : float
        Width of the substrate.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguides.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguides.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Positional offset between the waveguides. If posOffset is applied, the waveguides
        will be shifted relative to the middle position (y = 0) by half their width to avoid overlap.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['DC Length'] : float
        Length of the directional coupler.
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the y-axis.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the z-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters['Mode'] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters['Port Span'] : list of float
        Span of solver ports [x span, y span, z span].
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6:
Call StraightWaveguide EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("StraightWaveguide", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide (also used for MMI section height if applicable).
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters["Taper"] : bool
        If True, a taper is simulated; if False, only the straight waveguide is simulated.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Backside width of the taper. Frontside width equals the waveguide width.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper.
    Parameters["Taper Type"] : optional
        If provided, designs an inverse taper structure with no cladding.
        Additional required parameters:
            Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back'] : float
            Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back'] : float
            Parameters['PWB Taper Width Front'] : float
            Parameters['PWB Taper Height Front'] : float
            Parameters['PWB Taper Length'] : float

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the y-axis.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the z-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Waveguide Angle"] : float
        Rotation angle of the port. Can be 90 or 180 degrees.
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        [x span, y span, z span] of solver ports. Only y and z are used in this simulation.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7:
Call Wavelength Division Multiplexing (WDM) EME Solver with -> obj.Solver("WDM", "EME", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate in micrometers.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab material.

    --- MMI Section ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI section.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI section.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide (also height of the MMI section if applicable).
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Backside width of the taper. Frontside width equals the waveguide width.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['y res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the y-axis.
    Parameters['z res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the z-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters['Angle Theta'] : bool
        Angle for the input and output waveguides.
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        [x span, y span, z span] of solver ports. Only y and z are used in this simulation.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8:
Call MMI2x1 FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("MMI2x1", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab material.

    --- MMI Section ---
    Parameters['MMI Width'] : float
        Width of the MMI section.
    Parameters['MMI Length'] : float
        Length of the MMI section.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between the waveguides. If Taper == True, this becomes the offset between the wider sides of the tapers.
        Waveguides and tapers cannot be placed outside the MMI structure. Minimum distance = 1 μm.
    Parameters['Offset Input'] : float
        Offset of the input waveguide/taper.
    Parameters['Offset Output'] : anything, optional
        Allows moving the outputs in the opposite direction. Use with caution; only needed for specific fabrication cases.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        If True, tapers are added to input and output waveguides.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper if Parameters['Taper'] = True.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        [Span_x, Span_y, Span_z] of the solver ports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9:
Call MMI2x2 FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("MMI2x2", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

        Height of the slab material.

    --- MMI Section ---

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Length of the waveguide.
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between the waveguides. If Taper == True, this becomes the offset between the wider sides of the tapers.
        Waveguides and tapers cannot be placed outside the MMI structure. Minimum distance = 1 μm.

    --- Taper Options ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        If True, tapers are added to input and output waveguides.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper if Parameters['Taper'] = True.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        [Span_x, Span_y, Span_z] of the solver ports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10:
Call InverseTaper FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("InverseTaper", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab material.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height. Also the height of the MMI section.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Waveguide width.

    --- Photonic Wirebonding (PWB) ---
    Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back'] : float
        PWB width on the back side (to the photonic wire bonding).
    Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back'] : float
        PWB height on the back side (to the photonic wire bonding).
    Parameters['PWB Taper Width Front'] : float, optional
        PWB width on the front side (to the photonic waveguide). Optional.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Height Front'] : float, optional
        PWB height on the front side (to the photonic waveguide). Optional.
    Parameters['PWB Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the PWB taper.

    --- Fiber Parameters ---
    Parameters["SMF Core Diameter"] : float
        Single Mode Fiber core diameter.
    Parameters["SMF Cladding Diameter"] : float
        Single Mode Fiber cladding diameter.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans of the solver ports. For this simulation, only y and z are used.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
11:
Call Directional Coupler FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("DirectionalCoupler", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.
    Parameters['Substrate Width'] : float
        Width of the substrate.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguides.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the waveguides.
    Parameters['DC Length'] : float
        Length of the directional coupler.
    Parameters['Position Offset'] : float
        Offset between the two waveguides. If posOffset is applied, the waveguides
        will be shifted from the middle position (y = 0) by half their width.
        If Offset = 0, they will be centered and may overlap.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans of the solver ports.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
12:
Call StraightWaveguide FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("StraightWaveguide", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Length'] : float
        Waveguide length.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height (also the height of the MMI section if present).
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Waveguide width.
    Parameters["Taper"] : bool
        If False, only a straight waveguide is simulated.
        If True, a taper will be simulated.
    Parameters['Taper Width'] : float
        Backside width of the taper. Frontside width is the waveguide width.
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["Waveguide Angle"] : float
        Rotation angle (theta) of the port. Typically 90° or 180°.
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans for the solver ports. Only y and z are used for this simulation.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").

    --- Optional Taper Type ---
    Parameters["Taper Type"] : anything, optional
        If set (e.g., Parameters["Taper Type"]=1), an inverse taper structure without cladding
        will be designed. The "Cladding" option is ignored in this case.
        If not set, a normal taper will be simulated.

        If Parameters["Taper Type"] is given, the following additional parameters are required:
            Parameters['PWB Taper Width Back'] : float
                Photonic Wirebonding (PWB) width at the back side.
            Parameters['PWB Taper Height Back'] : float
                PWB height at the back side.
            Parameters['PWB Taper Width Front'] : float
                PWB width at the front side.
            Parameters['PWB Taper Height Front'] : float
                PWB height at the front side.
            Parameters['PWB Taper Length'] : float
                Length of the PWB taper.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13:
Call BendWaveguide FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("BendWaveguide", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height (also the height of the MMI section if present).

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters["x span"] : float
        Length of the S-bend waveguide.
    Parameters["y span"] : float
        Width of the S-bend waveguide.
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans for the solver ports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
14:
Call ArcWaveguide FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("ArcWaveguide", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

    --- Waveguide Section ---
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Waveguide height (also the height of the MMI section if present).
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Waveguide width.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the slab.
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.

    --- Arc Geometry ---
    Parameters["S_Band Radius"] : float
        S-bend radius in micrometers.
    Parameters['Arc deg'] : float
        Arc angle. Only 90 or 180 degrees are allowed (defines 1/4 or 1/2 circle).

    --- Mode & Ports ---
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans for the solver ports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
15:
Call GratingCoupler FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("GratingCoupler", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

    --- Grating Coupler Geometry ---
    Parameters["Length GC"] : float
        Length of the Grating Coupler area.
    Parameters["Width GC"] : float
        Width of the Grating Coupler area.
    Parameters["Hight GC"] : float
        Height of the Grating Coupler material.
    Parameters["Input Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide with the same WG height as the Grating Coupler, placed before the Grating Coupler region.
    Parameters["Output Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide with the same WG height as the Grating Coupler, placed after the Grating Coupler region.

    --- Taper ---
    Parameters['Taper'] : bool
        Add taper to the structure (True/False).
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the taper if Parameters['Taper'] = True.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.

    --- Mode & Ports ---
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans for the solver ports (only y and z are used for this simulation).
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
16:
Call RingGratingCoupler FDTD Solver with -> obj.Solver("RingGratingCoupler", "FDTD", Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Materials & Substrate ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.

    --- Grating Coupler Geometry ---
    Parameters["Length GC"] : float
        Length of the Grating Coupler area.
    Parameters["Width GC"] : float
        Width of the Grating Coupler area.
    Parameters["Hight GC"] : float
        Height of the Grating Coupler material.
    Parameters["GC Radius"] : float
        Radius of the Ring Grating Coupler in meters (e.g., Parameters["GC Radius"] = 25e-6).
    Parameters["Input Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide with the same WG height as the Grating Coupler, placed before the Grating Coupler region.
    Parameters["Output Length GC"] : float
        Square waveguide with the same WG height as the Grating Coupler, placed after the Grating Coupler region.

    --- Taper ---
    Parameters['Taper Length'] : float
        Length of the input taper.

    --- Solver Settings ---
    Parameters['Wavelength'] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
    Parameters['x res'] : float
        Mesh resolution along the x-axis.

    --- Mode & Ports ---
    Parameters["Mode"] : str
        Mode to choose from ("fundamental TE mode", "fundamental TM mode", "fundamental mode").
    Parameters["Port Span"] : list of float
        List of [x, y, z] spans for the solver ports (only y and z are used for this simulation).
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
17:
Call Wavelength Division Multiplexing / MZM Charge Solver with -> obj.MZM_ChargeSolver(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate & Waveguide ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the material slab. Can be set to 0 if no slab is present.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the top waveguide.

    --- Electrodes ---
    Parameters["GND Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the ground electrode.
    Parameters["Signal Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the signal electrode.
    Parameters["Electrodes Height"] : float
        Height of the metal electrodes.
    Parameters["Gap"] : float
        Gap between the waveguide and the electrodes, measured from the bottom of the waveguide to the electrodes.

    --- Simulation Settings ---
    Parameters["Wavelength"] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
18:
Call Wavelength Division Multiplexing / MZM FEEM Solver with -> obj.MZM_FEEMSolver(Parameters)

    Dictionary Parameters:

    --- Substrate & Waveguide ---
    Parameters['Substrate Height'] : float
        Height of the substrate.
    Parameters['Slab Height'] : float
        Height of the material slab. Can be set to 0 if no slab is present.
    Parameters['WG Height'] : float
        Height of the waveguide.
    Parameters['WG Width'] : float
        Width of the top waveguide.

    --- Electrodes ---
    Parameters["GND Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the ground electrode.
    Parameters["Signal Electrodes Width"] : float
        Width of the signal electrode.
    Parameters["Electrodes Height"] : float
        Height of the metal electrodes.
    Parameters["Gap"] : float
        Gap between the waveguide and the electrodes, measured from the bottom of the waveguide to the electrodes.

    --- Simulation Settings ---
    Parameters["Wavelength"] : float
        Simulation wavelength.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
